entry.title: We need to fix the block withholding attack
entry.summary: The discussion on the bitcoin-dev mailing list centered around the potential impact of KYC and DRM technology on block withholding attacks, which can be used to prevent dishonest behavior in mining pools. Emin GÃ¼n Sirer argued that such measures would negatively impact decentralization, as they would require identity verification and locked-down equipment, making it harder for new players to contribute hashing power and potentially centralizing control over the network. He also noted that some proposed solutions, such as Luke-Jr's idea of a secret k for each share, would require changes to the Bitcoin PoW. Ultimately, the thread emphasized the need for better mechanisms to keep mining pools in check without stifling innovation and decentralization.
